docs.snippet: Fidel Castro has lived mostly out of the public eye since a near-fatal illness in 2006 forced his retirement after nearly five decades at the helm of Cuba.
docs.lead_paragraph: Fidel Castro has lived mostly out of the public eye since a near-fatal illness in 2006 forced his retirement after nearly five decades at the helm of Cuba.

headline.main: Leaders Line Up to Visit Fidel Castro in Cuba
headline.print_headline: Leaders Line Up to Visit Fidel Castro in Cuba

docs.snippet: Most of the 32 nations coming to the World Cup in Brazil have picked training bases near Rio de Janeiro and Sao Paulo, with only a few venturing into the much hotter northeast or the colder south.
docs.lead_paragraph: Most of the 32 nations coming to the World Cup in Brazil have picked training bases near Rio de Janeiro and Sao Paulo, with only a few venturing into the much hotter northeast or the colder south.

headline.main: World Cup Teams Pick Camps Near Sao Paulo and Rio
headline.print_headline: World Cup Teams Pick Camps Near Sao Paulo and Rio

docs.snippet: President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner has said very little about the crisis that has led the nation’s currency to plunge.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner has said very little about the crisis that has led the nation’s currency to plunge.
docs.abstract: Argentine Pres Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner has yet to address currency crisis that has set off global concerns about the fragility of developing economies; Kirchner's absence during steepest currency plunge since country's economic collapse a decade ago has weakened her once-strong public image and fueled debate over whether a power vacuum is emerging.

headline.main: As Argentine Peso Falters, President Keeps a Low Profile
headline.print_headline: Cash Crisis: Silence in Argentina, Vague Signals in Turkey

byline.contributor: Fabián Werner contributed reporting from Montevideo, Uruguay.
byline.original: By SIMON ROMERO and JONATHAN GILBERT

docs.snippet: More than three-quarters of citizens believe that graft is widespread in their countries, the European Commission said in a report.
docs.lead_paragraph: More than three-quarters of citizens believe that graft is widespread in their countries, the European Commission said in a report.
docs.abstract: European Commission report says European Union, despite its relatively clean image, is losing at least 120 billion euros annually to corruption, and more than three-quarters of citizens believe problem is widespread in their countries.

headline.main: Study Details Graft in European Union
headline.print_headline: Study Details Graft in European Union

docs.snippet: Uruguay will play Northern Ireland in a World Cup warm-up match at the Centenario on May 30, a Uruguayan FA (AUF) official told Reuters on Tuesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay will play Northern Ireland in a World Cup warm-up match at the Centenario on May 30, a Uruguayan FA (AUF) official told Reuters on Tuesday.

headline.main: Uruguay to Play Northern Ireland in World Cup Warm-Up
headline.print_headline: Uruguay to Play Northern Ireland in World Cup Warm-Up

docs.snippet: Scotland voted overwhelmingly on Tuesday to allow same-sex marriages, becoming the 17th country to give the green light to gay marriage despite opposition from its main church organizations.
docs.lead_paragraph: Scotland voted overwhelmingly on Tuesday to allow same-sex marriages, becoming the 17th country to give the green light to gay marriage despite opposition from its main church organizations.

headline.main: Scotland Becomes Seventeenth Country to Approve Same-Sex Marriages
headline.print_headline: Scotland Becomes Seventeenth Country to Approve Same-Sex Marriages

docs.snippet: Uruguay forwards Luis Suarez and Edinson Cavani are the perfect age to shine at a World Cup and in June they will have the added bonus of experience after reaching the semi-finals in 2010, said coach Oscar Tabarez.
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay forwards Luis Suarez and Edinson Cavani are the perfect age to shine at a World Cup and in June they will have the added bonus of experience after reaching the semi-finals in 2010, said coach Oscar Tabarez.

headline.main: Suarez at a Perfect Age for World Cup-Tabarez
headline.print_headline: Suarez at a Perfect Age for World Cup-Tabarez

docs.snippet: British companies recognize the security threats posed by Mexico's drug violence but are more focused on opportunities in a batch of economic reforms in Latin America's No.2 economy, Britain's visiting deputy prime minister said on Wednesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: British companies recognize the security threats posed by Mexico's drug violence but are more focused on opportunities in a batch of economic reforms in Latin America's No.2 economy, Britain's visiting deputy prime minister said on Wednesday.

headline.main: UK Firms Fancy Mexico Despite Drug Violence-Clegg
headline.print_headline: UK Firms Fancy Mexico Despite Drug Violence-Clegg

docs.snippet: Hernanes is hoping his move to Inter Milan will help open the door to a place in Brazil's World Cup team though he failed to unravel the mystery as to his preferred position.

headline.main: Hernanes Hopes Inter Move Will Open World Cup Door
